channel.title: NASA Edge
channel.description: Audio podcast featuring information and interviews about NASA Edge.
channel.itunes:subtitle: The official podcast of www.nasa.gov: Get the latest audio from the NASA Portal, NASATV, and more.
channel.itunes:keywords: NASA, Portal, audio, MP3s, NASATV, shuttle, Discovery, This Week at NASA, news, space, Mars, Earth, shuttle, Moon, station, nati
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

item.title: NASA EDGE: Imaging Artemis I with SCIFLI
item.description: Artemis I is launching soon, and even NASA has its own front row seat for the launch with Scientifically Calibrated In-Flight Imagary (SCIFLI). During launch and recovery, the NASA SCIFLI team will capture super high-fidelity imagery of the rocket and parachutes on re-entry across multiple spectrums.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Honey, I Shrunk the Payload
item.description: NASA EDGE: Honey, I Shrunk the Payload

item.title: NASA EDGE: Geostationary Operational Environmental Satellite (GOES-T) Rollout Show
item.description: On February 28, 2022, NASA EDGE provided live coverage of the rollout of NOAA’s GOES-T satellite from the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Imagining X-ray Polarimetry Explorer (IXPE) Show
item.description: On December 8, 2021 NASA EDGE provided live coverage for the Imaging X-Ray Polarimetry Explorer (IXPE) mission from the Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Antarctic Eclipse Show
item.description: NASA EDGE talks NASA Heliophysics, NASA Solar Missions, Eclipses, and Space Weather as the perfect setup for exclusive, high-resolution footage of the 2021 Antarctic Total Solar Eclipse.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The DART Show
item.description: On November 22, 2021 NASA EDGE provide coverage of the transition of the SpaceX Falcon 9 going vertical prior to the launch of the Double Asteroid Redirection Test (DART) at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Laser Communication Relay Demonstration
item.description: Prior to the launch of the Laser Communication Relay Demonstration, the NASA EDGE Co-Host develops and tests his own version of laser communication as a proof of concept.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lucy Rollout Show
item.description: On October 14th, 2021 NASA EDGE provided live coverage of the Lucy Rollout at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. Several members of the Lucy team joined the show.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Landsat 9 Prelaunch Show
item.description: On Septenber 27th, 2021 NASA EDGE provided live coverage of the Landsat 9 Tower Roll at Vandenberg Space Force Center in California.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Bryan Russ
item.description: How do you top higher and higher drop tests? You add an extreme swing test to your portfolio.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Mark Baldwin
item.description: Will the Orion get the data it needs from this third key drop test and remain the uncontested bellyflop champion?

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Chris Kuhl
item.description: How did MEDLI2 get all of the incredible data during entry, descent, and landing on Mars?

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Kurt Leucht
item.description: If you’re looking to clear some space on the lunar surface, pick up some extra water, and break a few lunar travel distance records, look no further than the Lunar Pilot Excavator!

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Todd White
item.description: Perseverance is already collecting science on the surface of Mars, but MEDLI2 actually collected significant scientific data on the way to the surface.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Christine St. Germain
item.description: It is a huge challenge to send astronauts to the Moon, but it is also critical to bring them home safely.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Henry Wright
item.description: Not only did Mars 2020 and Perseverance survive the seven minutes of terror during entry, descent, and landing on the surface of Mars, they also collected a lot of key performance data!

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Michelle Munk 2
item.description: Our resident expert on Entry, Descent, and Landing (EDL) narrows her focus on the lunar landing with Stereo Camera for Lunar Plume Surface Studies (SCALPSS).

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Carey Scott
item.description: If you need to capture highly technical imagery of your spacecraft as it reenters the Earth’s atmosphere, look no further than CJ (Carey Scott) and the SCIFLI team at NASA Langley Research Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Sentinel-6 Prelaunch Show
item.description: On November 20th, 2020, NASA EDGE provided live prelaunch coverage of the Sentinel-6 Mike Freilich Satellite on L-1.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Mike Ciannilli
item.description: Netflix’s new documentary on the Space Shuttle Challenger has caused a lot of reflection and discussion about the tragedy.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with Keri Bean
item.description: Not many people can accurately claim to have driving experience on multiple planets, but Keri Bean can!

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with SPLICE Part 2
item.description: NASA EDGE continues to look at NASA’s Safe and Precise Landing – Integrated Capabilities Evolution (SPLICE) technology suite.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home with SPLICE Part 1
item.description: Technologies to enable exact and soft landings on the Moon and other worlds will fly on Blue Origin’s next New Shepard suborbital rocket launch.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Terry Fong
item.description: To really understand the geology of the Moon, you need to dig. NASA’s very first lunar rover, VIPER, is designed to do just that.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mars 2020 Rollout
item.description: On July 28th, 2020, NASA EDGE provided live coverage of the Mars 2020 Rollout just days ahead of the launch.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: with In-Space Assembly at NASA Langley & 200th Show
item.description: NASA EDGE takes a look at two technologies related to Space exploration, the Lunar Surface Manipulation System (LSMS) and In Space Assembly.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Michelle Munk
item.description: When it comes to space exploration, it is vitally important to stick the landing! NASA Systems Capability Lead for Entry, Descent, and Landing (EDL) Michelle Munk joins the show to talk about his challenging process. Check it out!

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Rob Mueller
item.description: NASA Swamp Works Senior Technologist Rob Mueller joins the show to talk about the innovation needed as NASA plans its return to the Moon.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Paul Dees
item.description: Lowering the sonic boom with the X-59 still requires a high performance engine, and Franklin, from NASA EDGE, talked with Deputy Propulsion Lead for X-59 QueSST Paul Dees about NASA’s recent engine tests as they continue to develop this uniquely quiet x-plane. Check it out!

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Steve Gaddis
item.description: NASA EDGE chats with NASA Deputy for the Launch Vehicle Office for Commercial Crew Steve Gaddis about the successful launch of DM-2 and future missions for NASA Commercial Crew!

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Bob Moses
item.description: Senior Aerospace Technologist Bob Moses joins the show to talk about how NASA plans to keep astronauts safe while living and working on the lunar surface.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Pat Troutman
item.description: Join NASA EDGE as Chris and Lunar Architecture guru Pat Troutman talk about the challenge of designing NASA’s first sustainable lunar outpost for Artemis.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Jennifer Inman
item.description: Capturing visual data from a spacecraft travelling at 17,000 plus miles per hour from a safe distance is a big challenge, and that is exactly what Jennifer Inman and the SCIFLI team do when spacecraft return to Earth.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Chris Wohl
item.description: You need more than household cleaner to tackle the dust problem on the lunar surface, and NASA Researcher Chris Wohl discusses the many strategies being developed by NASA to keep our equipment and astronauts safe while working on the Moon.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Nicky Fox
item.description: Franklin checks in with NASA’s Division Chief of Heliophysics, Nicky Fox, to find out how current solar missions for NASA and ESA are providing profound new insight and data about our Sun.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Chuck Taylor
item.description: Power is a big part of every NASA mission, and Artemis is no exception. Chuck Taylor, from the Space Technology and Exploration Directorate at NASA Langley Research Center, joins the show to talk about how NASA is investigating and developing plans to provide power to all assets heading to the lunar surface.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Mic Woltman
item.description: NASA EDGE continues their series at home with special guest Mic Woltman from NASA Launch Services Program at NASA Kennedy Space Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE@ Home: Interview with Jim Green
item.description: Operating safely from their homes, NASA Chief Scientist Jim Green along with Blair and Franklin from NASA EDGE discuss how NASA is continuing its mission during this unique time of telework and sheltering in place.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Solar Orbiter Rollout
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage of the Atlas V Rollout for ESA’s Solar Orbiter Mission. With ESA leading the effort on the Solar Orbiter, science is the real winner as both ESA and NASA continue the focus on Heliophysics missions.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Navigation Doppler Lidar
item.description: NASA EDGE takes a close look at NASA Langley Research Center’s development of Navigation Doppler Lidar (NDL) to provide accurate, surface-relative altitude and vector velocity data to make sure NASA can land spacecraft safely on the Moon and any surface.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Apollo, Challenger, Columbia Lessons Learned Program
item.description: NASA EDGE sits down with Mike Ciannilli of the Apollo, Challeger, Columbia Lessons Learned Program (ACCLLP) to talk about NASA is using the tragedies of the past to make sure we improve our processes moving forward.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS in Mixed Reality
item.description: NASA EDGE moves between virtual and mixed reality while learning about the new focus for the Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission (MMS).

item.title: NASA EDGE: ICESat-2 Tower Rollback
item.description: NASA EDGE provided live coverage of the scheduled tower rollback for United Launch Alliance’s final Delta II rocket carrying the ICESat-2 spacecraft.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Parker Solar Probe Tower Rollback
item.description: NASA EDGE provided live coverage of the scheduled tower rollback for the Delta IV Heavy carrying the Parker Solar Probe just prior to launch from Space Launch Complex 37 at Cape Canaveral Air Station in Florida.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Dragonfly Program Manager
item.description: NASA EDGE interviews Dragonfly Program Manager Jennifer Dawson about the latest developments in robotic assembly in space, and how having this flexibility allows NASA and its partners to think differently about building and operating structures in space.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Archinaut Project Manager
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Made in Space at NASA Ames Research Center to learn about Archinaut, a suite of capabilities for space manufacturing, robotic assembly, and verification and validation.

item.title: NASA EDGE: CIRAS Lead Systems Engineer
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Orbital ATK (now Northrop Grumman) to interview Lead Systems Engineer Dave Bodkin about the tools being developed for Commercial Infrastructure for Robotic Assembly and Services (CIRAS) and how these tools will potentially be used for missions in space.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Countdown to ICON/Pegasus Ferry Flight
item.description: NASA EDGE webcasts live from the Hot Pad at Vandenberg Air Force Base as the Orbital ATK Stargazer prepares to transport the Pegasus Rocket carrying the Ionospheric Connection Explorer (ICON) to its eventual launch destination, the Kwajalein Atoll.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MarCO Chief Engineer
item.description: NASA EDGE talks with Chief Engineer Andy Klesh about NASA's Mars Cubesat One A & B (MarCO), the first cubesat mission to the Red Planet.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mars InSight Rollback with MarCO
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage of tower rollback in preparation for NASA’s first launch to Mars from the West Coast.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite
item.description: NASA EDGE takes an in-depth look at the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) Mission just hours before launch from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station. Discover how NASA and its partners from MIT developed sophisticated cameras to capture a full sky survey of the most likely Earth-like planets outside our solar system.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Low-Boom Flight Demonstration
item.description: NASA EDGE is joined in studio by David Richwine, Deputy Project Manager for Technology for the Low-Boom Flight Demonstration to discuss NASA's current effort to develop ground breaking aircraft design and promote regulatory change for commercial supersonic flight over land.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Low-Boom Flight Demonstration Promo
item.description: The great aviation transformation begins now as NASA moves ahead with the development of an X-Plane designed to demonstrate low-boom technology and promote regulatory change for commercial supersonic flight.

item.title: NASA EDGE: GOES-S Rollout
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage during the GOES-S rollout the day before its historic launch from Space Launch Complex 41 at NASA Kennedy Space Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE: GOES-R Series Products Manager
item.description: NASA EDGE talks with Dr. Jamese Sims about how scientists at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) are evaluating data and developing specific products to serve the meteorological community.

item.title: NASA EDGE: NOAA's Research Meteorologist
item.description: NASA EDGE talks with Jose Galvez, Research Meteorologist for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) International Weather Prediction Desk, about how the new capabilities of the GOES-R series of satellites helps weather prediction in the continental United States and other countries in the Western Hemisphere.

item.title: NASA EDGE: CubeSat Promo
item.description: NASA EDGE provides a look into the CubeSat world.

item.title: NASA EDGE: JPSS-1 Satellite Operations
item.description: NASA EDGE interviews NOAA’s Office of Satellite and Product Operations Director Vanessa Griffin about how NOAA supports the Joint Polar Satellite Sytem once it is in orbit.

item.title: NASA EDGE: JPSS-1 Tower Rollback
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage of Tower Rollback for the Joint Polar Satellite Sytem spacecraft.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS Mission with Tom Moore
item.description: NASA EDGE meets with Project Scientist Tom Moore to update the progress of the Magnestopheric Multiscale Mission (MMS). Magnetic reconnection is happening in Space and the MMS spacecraft are capturing the data and getting a much clearer picture of this phenomena.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS Mission with AP Physics Students
item.description: Franklin talks to three AP Physics students from Oxon Hill High School in Maryland about their class project demonstrating magnetic reconnection.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Virtual Reality in the STEM Innovation Lab
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the STEM Innovation Lab at NASA Goddard Space Flight Center to discover how Virtual Reality is being used to promote science and engineering.

item.title: Space Weather
item.description: NASA’s Human Research Program (HRP) looks at how space weather will impact astronauts when they leave Low Earth Orbit.

item.title: The Challenges for Astronauts on the Journey to Mars
item.description: NASA’s Human Research Program (HRP) outlines some of the major challenges facing our astronauts for the journey to Mars.

item.title: NASA Space Radiation Laboratory
item.description: NASA’s Human Research Program (HRP) visits the NASA Space Radiation Laboratory (NSRL) to get a closer look at how NASA simulates cosmic rays for research.

item.title: Space Radiation
item.description: NASA’s Human Research Program (HRP) looks into the three kinds of space radiation.

item.title: The Biological Consequences of Space Radiation
item.description: The Human Research Program (HRP) explores the biological consequences of space radiation for astronauts during space flight. Subject matter experts Tony Slaba (Research Physicist) and Peter Guida (Liaison Biologist NASA Space Radiation Laboratory) describe just how space radiation impacts the human body during space flight. Produced by NASA EDGE.

item.title: NASA EDGE: TDRS-M with David Littmann
item.description: NASA EDGE talks to Tracking and Data Relay Satellite M (TDRS-M) Project Manager David Littmann about the how it fits into the broader TDRS Network.

item.title: NASA EDGE: TDRS-M Communications with Neil Mallik
item.description: NASA EDGE’s Franklin Fitzgerald sits down with NASA Human Space Flight Deputy Network Director Neil Mallik to talk about how the Tracking and Data Relay Satellite M (TDRS-M) plays into NASA’s Space Network.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Future Of Commercial Supersonic Travel
item.description: NASA Langley Research Center’s Peter Coen (Commercial Supersonic Technology Program Manager) and David Richwine (Quiet Supersonic Technology Project Manager) explain how advances in design could help reduce the impact of sonic booms and promote supersonic flight over land.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Best of SAGE III Installation Coverage
item.description: NASA EDGE webcasts live in front the of the Flight Mission Support Center (FMSC) at NASA Langley Research Center as the SAGE III Team monitors the final stages of installation on the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Best of SAGE III Launch Coverage
item.description: NASA EDGE provides coverage of the successful launch of SAGE III aboard the SpaceX Faclon 9 from historic pad 39A at NASA Kennedy Space Center. The Stratospheric Aerosal and Gas Experiment (SAGE III) is the first science instrument to be mounted on the International Space Station and will help sustain the vital atmospheric data record of previous

item.title: NASA EDGE: Flight Projects
item.description: Deputy Director of Flight Projects Steve Gaddis is going for NASA EDGE Platinum Status by joining Franklin and Blair in the studio for an unprecedented fourth appearance.

item.title: NASA EDGE: CYGNSS Pre Launch Live Coverage
item.description: NASA EDGE broadcasts live from Hanger AE at the Cape Canaveral Air Station to provide coverage for the Cyclone Global Navigation Satellite System (CYGNSS) Launch from Orbital ATK’s Stargazer L-1011.

item.title: NASA EDGE: GOES-R Pre Launch Live Coverage
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage of the launch of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s (NOAA) latest weather and scientific satellite designed to improve real time critical weather forecasting and warning systems.

item.title: NASA EDGE: OSIRIS REx Pre Launch Live Coverage
item.description: NASA EDGE provides prelaunch coverage of the OSIRIS REx Launch Live from NASA Kennedy Space Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Magnetospheric Multiscale (MMS) Mission Update: Alexander Barrie
item.description: NASA EDGE and Fast Plasma Investigations Lead Alexander Barrie for MMS discuss the challenge of keeping the instruments running and properly calibrated while examining magnetic reconnection.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Magnetospheric Multiscale (MMS) Mission Update: Conrad Schiff
item.description: Plasma Physicist Conrad Schiff updates NASA EDGE on the health and performance of all four spacecraft. With four times the data, NASA is getting an unprecedented look at the phenomenon of magnetic reconnection.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Magnetospheric Multiscale (MMS) Mission Update with Daniel Gershman
item.description: NASA EDGE and Plasma Scientist Daniel Gershman discuss how the Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission Team is processing and handling the date from the spacecrafts.

item.title: Viking 40th Anniversary: The Viking Team
item.description: The challenge of landing on Mars pushed the Viking mission team to greatness.

item.title: Viking 40th Anniversary: Legacy of Viking
item.description: Viking’s accomplishments and contributions are still felt in every NASA planetary mission to date.

item.title: Viking 40th Anniversary: Jim Martin
item.description: Remembering the significant contributions of Viking Mission Manager Jim Martin.

item.title: Viking 40th Anniversary: Life on Mars
item.description: Former NASA Senior Research Scientist Joel Levine discusses Viking’s valuable contribution to the science behind discovering life on Mars.

item.title: Viking 40th Anniversary: Entry, Descent and Landing
item.description: Discover how NASA tackled the unique challenge of Entry, Descent, and Landing to successfully land Viking on Mars.

item.title: Viking 40th Anniversary: First Images
item.description: NASA Scientists reflect on the significance of seeing the first images of Mars sent from Viking.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Solar Eclipse 2017 Preview Show
item.description: If you want signs and wonders, NASA EDGE has you covered with a preview of the most significant astronomical event in years: the Total Solar Eclipse 2017.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Scalable Technologies
item.description: NASA EDGE is back in studio to look at two of NASA’s major Technology Demonstration Missions, Green Propellant Infusion Mission (GPIM) and Evolvable Cryogenics (eCryo).

item.title: NASA EDGE: Game Changing Entry, Descent and Landing Part 2
item.description: NASA EDGE continues their in-depth look at the latest Entry, Descent and Landing (EDL) technologies being developed at NASA.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Game Changing Entry, Descent and Landing Part 1
item.description: NASA EDGE gives an in depth look at the latest Entry, Descent and Landing (EDL) technologies being developed at NASA.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Jason 3 Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Jason 3 Mission launch from Vandenberg Air Force Base in California.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Game Changing Robotics
item.description: Game Changing Development Program Manager Steve Gaddis joins NASA EDGE in studio to discuss robotics, rovers and perhaps an upgrade at co-host.

item.title: NASA EDGE: RaD-X Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE provides live coverage of the Radiation Dosimetry Experiment (RaD-X) launch from NASA Langley Research Center and the Columbia Scientific Balloon Facility in Fort Sumner, NM.

item.title: NASA EDGE: BisonSat
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the Salish Kootenai College in Pablo, Montana to check out their first CubeSat BisonSat!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Additive Manufacturing In Space - 3D Printing
item.description: NASA EDGE looks into NASA's use of 3D printing on the International Space Station. Plus, they learn how students are helping astronauts through a partnership with Future Engineers.

item.title: NASA EDGE: New Horizons
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates New Horizons' eminent closest approach to Pluto with their own parallel mission to Pluto, West Virginia.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Nanotechnology
item.description: NASA EDGE explores the latest developments with NASA's game changing Nanotechnology. Going small yields big results!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mars Ascent Vehicle Prize
item.description: What do you get when you add robotics and autonomy to rocketry? You get NASA's latest Centennial Challenge. Find which teams were awarded the ellusive Mars Ascent Vehicle Prize.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the launch of the four identical Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission (MMS) spacecraft from Space Launch Complex 45 at Cape Canaveral. Special guests include Alex Young, Susan Pope, Craig Pollock, Paul Gross and Troy Cline.

item.title: NASA EDGE: ELaNa X Deployment
item.description: NASA EDGE joins the ELaNa X Teams as their CubeSats deploy less than two hours after a successful ride into space.  Dr. Charles Norton (NASA JPL) and Scott Higginbotham (NASA Kennedy) share the excitement with students from Montana State University and Cal Poly San Luis Obispo.

item.title: NASA EDGE: SMAP Launch
item.description: Join NASA EDGE as they cover the launch of the Soil Moisture Active Passive (SMAP) spacecraft live from Vandenberg Air Force Base.  Special guests include NASA Administrator Charlie Bolden, SMAP Project System Engineer Shawn Goodman and Lt Col Brande Walton and Joseph Sims from the Air Force.  No word on the Co-Host's whereabouts. &n

item.title: Testing NASA's Low-Density Supersonic Decelerator
item.description: NASA EDGE visits NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory to check in with the Low-Density Supersonic Decelerator Team. Find out how NASA's Space Technology Mission Directorate is helping to pave the way for entry descent and landing of humans on Mars.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Talking MMS - Part 2
item.description: Chris continues his talk with more members of the Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission (MMS) team.  Enthusiasm is high ahead of their upcoming launch.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Talking MMS - Part 1
item.description: Chris sits down with members of the Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission (MMS) team to talk about their work, experiences and expectations for this groundbreaking engineering achievement and scientific mission.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mission X 2014
item.description: NASA EDGE travels to Belgium for the Mission X 2014 International Closing Event.  Special guests include European Space Agency Astronaut Frank De Winne, Mission X Students and more!

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Future is Bright @NASA_KSC with Bob Cabana
item.description: NASA EDGE interviews NASA Kennedy Space Center Directer Bob Cabana during their coverage of SpaceX CRS-3. Find out about commercial space, future NASA launches and lounge singers!

item.title: NASA EDGE: OCO-2 Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE webcasts live from Vandenberg AFB for the launch of the Orbiting Carbon Observatory-2 (OCO) launch.

item.title: NASA EDGE: SpaceX-3
item.description: NASA EDGE checks out the experiments heading to the International Space Station and the CubeSats being launched during SpaceX's 3rd resupply mission.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS One Step Closer to Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE talks with the MMS Team about the final tests for the satellites before they head to NASA Kennedy.

item.title: NASA EDGE: TDRS-L Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE talks Space Communication and Navigation while covering the TDRS-L Launch atop the Vehicle Assembly Building at NASA Kennedy Space Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Launching CUNYSAT-1
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the ELaNa II launch and speaks to Medgar Evers students about launching CUNYSAT-1; their first CubeSat.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Technology Demonstration Missions Part 3
item.description: NASA EDGE visits NASA Ames during their telerobics demontration with K-10 and the ISS.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Technology Demonstration Missions Part 2
item.description: NASA EDGE explores three more NASA Technology Demonstration Missions; Deep Space Atomic Clock, Solar Sails and the Low-Density Supersonic Decelerator.

item.title: NASA EDGE: LADEE Launch
item.description: Enjoy highlights from the LADEE Launch with NASA EDGE and many of their guests, including NASA Administrator Charlie Bolden.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mission X 2013
item.description: NASA EDGE joins the Mission X Team as they finish another successful year of training like an astronaut.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Regolith Mining Competition
item.description: Check out highlights from NASA EDGE's live coverage of the 2013 Regolith Mining Competition and let the regolith fly!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Service Module
item.description: NASA EDGE interviews Bernardo Patti about the Orion Service Module being built by the European Space Agency.

item.title: NASA EDGE: CubeSat Workshop
item.description: NASA EDGE and special guest host Tiffany Nail explore the latest developments in nanosat technology at the 10th Annual CubeSat Development Workshop.  MagnetoStar-1, however, still won't fly.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Planetary Defense
item.description: NASA EDGE and Special Guest Geoff Notkin speak with NASA Scientists and experts around the world at the 2013 Planetary Defense Conference about Near Earth Objects and their potential threat to Earth.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Space Launch System
item.description: NASA EDGE checks out NASA's new Space Launch System [SLS] which will help astronauts explore beyond Low Earth Orbit.  Will the Co-Host's SLS pass the test?

item.title: NASA EDGE: Understanding Aurora with VISIONS
item.description: NASA EDGE Host Chris Giersch talks with NASA Heliophysicist Doug Rowland about how VISIONS will help scientists better understand auroras.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Go, No Go for Launch
item.description: NASA EDGE talks to Sarah Daugherty, a Wallops Flight Facility Test Director, about what it takes to manage a successful rocket launch.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Solar Max-Storm Warning
item.description: NASA EDGE presents highlights from their live coverage of this year's celebration, Sun-Earth Days: Solar Max-Storm Warning.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Magnetic Reconnection
item.description: NASA EDGE revisits MMS for an in depth look at the greatest mystery of the magnetosphere; magnetic reconnection.

item.title: NASA EDGE: CubeSat Launch Initiative
item.description: Find out how NASA is helping students fly their own satellites.  Plus, the Co-Host pitches his very own CubeSat concept.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Technology Demonstration Mission - Part 1
item.description: NASA EDGE takes the role of investigator to an entirely new level as they examine three of NASA's Technology Demonstration Missions.

item.title: NASA EDGE: NASA Lowers the Sonic Boom
item.description: NASA wants to reduce the impact of the "boom" in super sonic flight and make traveling beyond the speed of sound more common.  Find out how on NASA EDGE.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Astronomy Expo
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the Arizona Science and Astronomy Expo while the Co-Host focuses on preventing the mysterious Ocular Ring.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Exploration Flight Test-1
item.description: NASA EDGE talks Orion and its preparation for Exploration Flight Test-1 [EFT-1] while the Co-Host explores an interesting new partnership.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lesa Roe
item.description: NASA EDGE, or at least part of the NASA EDGE team, interviews Lesa Roe about NASA's role in Human Space exploration.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Needs Your Vote
item.description: NASA EDGE has been nominated for Best Video Podcast.  Find out how you can help them win from Luke Wilson.  Go online and vote.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MSL Curiosity Landing
item.description: Enjoy highlights from NASA EDGE's live coverage of Curiosity's landing on Mars from MediaCityUK in Salford, United Kingdom.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MSL Sample Analysis at Mars
item.description: NASA EDGE learns about the Sample Analysis at Mars [SAM] instrument currently operating on the Martian surface.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MSL Life on Mars
item.description: Jim Garvin discusses Curiosity's unique opportunity to learn about Mars and if life could have existed on the red planet.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Transit of Venus
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the Transit of Venus from NASA's Infrared Telescope Facility atop Mauna Kea in Hawaii.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MSL Mobility
item.description: Franklin vistis NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory to talk to Jaret Matthews about Curiosity's unique robotic capability to explore the Martian surface.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Biogeochemistry with Curiosity
item.description: NASA's Jennifer Eigenbrode talks with NASA EDGE about the organic Biogeochemistry Curiosity is tackling on the surface of Mars.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Dust Project
item.description: Hampton University teams up with NASA to help teachers, students and NASA EDGE understand the relationship between dust and climate change.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mars Yard
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the Mars Yard at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory to learn more about Curiosity and how it will function on the red planet.

item.title: NASA EDGE: MEDLI
item.description: NASA EDGE gets underneath the heat shield to learn about MEDLI, the Mars Science Laboratory Entry Descent and Landing Instrumentation.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lunabotics 2012
item.description: NASA EDGE presents highlights of the 2012 Lunabotics Mining Competition from the Kennedy Space Center Visitors Complex.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Venus Transit with Richard Vondrack
item.description: NASA Planetary Scientist, Richard Vondrack, discusses the dynamic relationship between the Sun and the planets in our Solar System with NASA EDGE.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Venus Transit with Dean Pesnell
item.description: Solar Physicist, Dean Pesnell, talks about the Solar Dynamic Observatory (SDO) and the Transit of Venus with the NASA EDGE.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Venus Transit with James Garvin
item.description: Jim Garvin, Chief Scientist from NASA Goddard Space Flight Center, talks Transit of Venus with NASA EDGE.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Venus Transit with Gordon Chin
item.description: NASA EDGE interviews NASA Planetary Scientist Gordon Chin for the 2012 Transit of Venus.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Venus Transit with Jim Green
item.description: NASA EDGE Interviews Jim Green, NASA's Director of Planetary Science, ahead of the Transit of Venus.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mission X 2012
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Cumberland School in East London for Mission X 2012!

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS Propulsion
item.description: NASA EDGE looks at the development of the propulsion system for the Magnetospheric MultiScale Mission.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Charlie Bolden
item.description: NASA EDGE races to interview NASA Administrator Charlie Bolden.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2011 Recap
item.description: NASA EDGE combines recreation and research as they look back over 2011.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2011 Green Flight Challenge
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the Green Flight Challenge and witnesses an aviation first, true electric flight!

item.title: NASA EDGE: MMS
item.description: Finally, NASA has a mission dedicated to specifically explore the mysteries of Magnetospherence; the Magnetospheric MultiScale Mission [MMS]

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Drop Test
item.description: NASA keeps the pool open all year round.  Time for Orion to make another splash!

item.title: NASA EDGE: DISCOVER-AQ
item.description: Aerosols can run, but they can't hide from DISCOVER-AQ's bevy of data gathering gizmos.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Live STS-135
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the historic final launch of the Space Shuttle Atlantis!

item.title: NASA EDGE: X Hab Competition
item.description: Interested in adding a second level to your Habitat Demonstration Unit?  Check out the awesome student designs.  All Co-Host approved!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Innovative Technologies
item.description: Join NASA EDGE as they explore technologies currently being developed by NASA and their partners.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Live Lunabotics Mining Competition 2011
item.description: Lunar regolith simulant flies as NASA EDGE covers the 2nd annual Lunabotics Mining Competition!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Live STS-134
item.description: NASA EDGE covers the 25th and final launch of Space Shuttle Endeavour!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mission X
item.description: NASA EDGE learns how Mission X helps kids around the world learn about fitness while training like an astronaut.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Live Sun-Earth Day 2011
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates Sun Earth Day 2011 with the twitterazzi and a few of our favorite solar scientists!  SPF approved.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Live Transit of Venus Promo
item.description: NASA EDGE promotes their live coverage for a major, unique and predictable astronamical event in 2012!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Space Life Sciences Lab
item.description: NASA EDGE prepares for life in Space by investigating dust mitigation and interstellar gardening at NASA Kennedy's Space Life Sciences Lab.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Radiation Belt Storm Probes
item.description: NASA EDGE investigates NASA's most ambitious look at the Earth's radiation belt to date; the Radiation Belt Storm Probes Mission.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2010 Recap
item.description: NASA EDGE looks back at the highlights of 2010 and makes a few key goals for the new year.

item.title: NASA EDGE: A-Train
item.description: Jump on board NASA's A-Train, the premier constellation of Earth observing satellites.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Hurricane GRIP
item.description: NASA EDGE gets a GRIP on tropical storms and hurricane development.

item.title: NASA EDGE: D-RATS 2010
item.description: This year's D-RATS test features two rovers.  And as everyone knows, twice the science equals twice the fun.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Future of Aeronautics
item.description: The future of Aeronautics at NASA involves excellent in-flight and environmental upgrades... however, no drink coupons - not even for the Co-Host.

item.title: NASA EDGE: STORRM
item.description: It isn't exactly ISS valet service, but NASA STORRM should provide major docking improvements for future flights to the Space Station.

item.title: NASA EDGE: D-RATS 2010 Trailer
item.description: NASA EDGE will be webcasting live from Black Point Lava Flow, AZ during this year's analog test. More details soon!

item.title: NASA EDGE: Extreme Analogs 2
item.description: NASA EDGE immerses themselves in another extreme analog, NEEMO. It isn't quite 20,000 leagues, but it is clearly underwater.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lunabotics Mining Competition 2010
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the Astronaut Hall of Fame NASA's 1st Annual Lunabotics Mining Competition

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Pad Abort 1 Flight Test
item.description: High winds didn't dampen the Orion team's enthusiasm or the succes of the Orion Pad Abort 1 Flight Test at White Sands Missile Range, New Mexico.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Robonaut 2
item.description: Jacky and Franklin go behind the scenes with Robonaut 2.  They even learn the super secret Robonaut handshake.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Sun-Earth Day 2010
item.description: Catch the best of NASA EDGE Live from this year's culminating solar celebratory event, Sun-Earth Day 2010.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Fahrenheit 6000
item.description: NASA EDGE talks with both NASA and ATK engineers about the Development Motor Test Firing in Promontory, Utah.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Launch Abort System
item.description: NASA EDGE previews the development of Orion's Launch Abort System and discovers Chris's fascination with smocks.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mercury Mission Control
item.description: NASA EDGE visits the brilliantly restored Mercury Mission Control Center exhibit at the Kennedy Space Center Visitor Complex in Florida.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Extreme Analogs
item.description: NASA EDGE follows the Desert RATS around Black Point Lava Flow, AZ during their 14 day analog field test of the Lunar Electric Rover [LER].

item.title: NASA EDGE: Ares 1-X Live Part 2
item.description: After multiple delays, Ares 1-X makes its historic flight live on NASA EDGE (Part 2).

item.title: NASA EDGE: Ares 1-X Live Part 1
item.description: Chris, Blair, Franklin and Jacky cover the historic launch of Ares 1-X [part 1].

item.title: NASA EDGE: Hometown Heroes
item.description: NASA EDGE joins Astronaut Mike Massimino and Twitter phenomenon (@Astro_Mike) as he returns home to the Big Apple to talk about STS-125.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Apollo 40th After Party
item.description: NASA EDGE crashes the Apollo XII anniversary celebration for a little after party rocket experience.

item.title: NASA EDGE: SDO
item.description: It isn't safe to stare at the Sun for you or the NASA EDGE team, but SDO will be able to do it with ease 24/7.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Apollo XI 40th Anniversary
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates the 40th anniversary for Apollo XI by interviewing NASA Apollo Engineer Ed Kilgore.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Orion Sims
item.description: Whether you're working on Orion Feng Shui or docking with the ISS, NASA EDGE explores the latest in Orion Simulators from Lockheed Martin and NASA.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Shuttle IR Imaging
item.description: Far from point and shoot, HYTHIRM's Cast Glance Crew have turned shooting infrared images of the Shuttle into an art form.

item.title: NASA EDGE: STS-125
item.description: From Shuttle launch to breakthrough research during landings, NASA EDGE covers the latest, greatest mission to Hubble; STS-125.

item.title: NASA EDGE: LRO LCROSS
item.description: NASA EDGE taks a close look at NASA's first step in the return to the Moon, LRO and LCROSS.  Chris, Blair and Franklin interview both teams and round out the show with a little bit of Launch Services Program.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Mission Madness Wrap Up
item.description: NASA EDGE announces the winner for the 2009 Mission Madness Tournament

item.title: NASA EDGE: Ares 1-X Crew Module and Launch Abort System
item.description: Blair and Franklin take a quick look at the Crew Module and Launch Abort System for Ares 1-X with Deputy Project Manager Jonathan Cruz.

item.title: NASA EDGE: 2009 NASA Mission Madness
item.description: NASA EDGE presents the 2009 NASA Mission Madness Vodcast with special guests Miles O'Brien, Keith Cowing and Melvin Ferebee.  Let the trash talking begin as we determine NASA's greatest mission of all time.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Constellation
item.description: NASA EDGE heads to NASA Kennedy to take a look at several pieces of the Constellation program. Plus viewer voice mail with Sten the Intern.

item.title: NASA EDGE: SPR
item.description: Chris interviews the NASA team working on the Small Pressurized Rover [SPR].  Blair is lost in No-CoHost, AZ.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Moses Lake
item.description: Chris, Blair and Franklin visit the regatta of regolith at Moses Lake to check out NASA's latest lunar lineup.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lunar Robot Arm
item.description: It slices!  It dices!  Not really, but the Lunar Surface Manipulator System (LSMS), or NASA's Lunar Robotic Arm as the Co-Host calls it, is one potential workhorse for NASA's Lunar Outpost.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Physics Day
item.description: NASA EDGE and a crack team of physicists from NASA Glenn Research Center visit Cedar Point Amusement Park to conduct Physics experiments and track down superheroes.

item.title: NASA EDGE: eZLS
item.description: NASA EDGE does a few laps on the ISS, the Moon and Mars with NASA Glenn Research Center's Exercise Countermeasures Team.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Folklife Festival
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates NASA's 50th anniversary at the Smithsonian Folklife Festival in Washington, DC with interviews, an ESA and a unique lunar rover race.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lunar Hab
item.description: NASA EDGE visits one of NASA's lunar habitat concepts. Chris conducts an interview with Karen Witley, while Blair conducts his own unique research.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Last Mission to Hubble
item.description: NASA EDGE features the Last Mission to Hubble with an inside and outside Hubble quiz, an interview with a Hubble engineer, and insight from the STS-125 astronauts.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Experience Aviation
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Experience Aviation with Barrington Irving. Jacky interviews Barrington while Blair and Franklin try to compete in their flight simulators.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Yuri's Night
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates Yuri Gagarin’s groundbreaking space flight with their friends at NASA Ames. Franklin introduces a new segment: Shuttle Bay Confessions.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Great Moonbuggy Race
item.description: NASA EDGE, along with 60 plus high school and college teams, braved the elements and the obstacles for NASA Marshall Space Flight Center's Annual Great Moonbuggy Race.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Daytona 500
item.description: NASA EDGE celebrates dual 50th’s: NASA & and the Daytona 500. And we have interviews with NASCAR Driver Kurt Busch and NASA Astronauts Drew Feustel and Mike Good.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Future Forum en Espanol
item.description: NASA EDGE Live The Future Forum, en Espanol.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Live Future Forum
item.description: Blair takes the helm at NASA's Future Forum. Can Franklin and Jacky bail him out?

item.title: NASA EDGE: Winter X 12
item.description: Whether you're  an Astronaut or an X Games Athlete, everyone needs a great support crew.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Orion FTA
item.description: NASA EDGE gets an outside look at the Orion Flight Test Article.  The jury is out on the inside look.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The 411 at NASA Dryden
item.description: This isn't your father's Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy, it's NASA Dryden's SOFIA and Ikhana projects... plus, special guests.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Magnetospherence
item.description: Sun-Earth Day 2008 Sol Man Troy Cline visits the NASA EDGE Studio to talk about Solar Week. Plus Blair revisits the Space Weather Action Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Space Shuttle Sim
item.description: Chris and Blair search for an alternate landing site while flying the Space Shuttle Sim.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Lunar Architecture
item.description: Chris, Blair and Franklin check out the lunar outpost floor plans, pick out wallpaper and order a double-wide garage for SCOUT.

item.title: NASA EDGE: X Games Los Angeles
item.description: NASA EDGE crash the Summer X Games in Los Angeles, CA.

item.title: NASA EDGE: M113
item.description: NASA EDGE puts the M113 through its paces!

item.title: NASA EDGE: STS-118
item.description: Who sais tailgating and Shuttle launches have nothing in common?

item.title: NASA EDGE: Road Trip Part 2
item.description: Blair has 1,000 miles to figure out where to find a real Space Shuttle launch schedule... or else.

item.title: NASA EDGE: The Moonbuggy Race
item.description: Driven by the maniacal Coach Blair and his diabolical stategy for victory, Chris and NASA EDGE Intern Brandon Endo gear up for the the Moonbuggy Race.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Road Trip Part 1
item.description: Follow the NASA EDGE team as they take a road trip to NASA Kennedy Space Center to see a Space Shuttle launch.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Gantry
item.description: NASA EDGE visits Langley's gantry to watch a drop test of a potential Orion Crew Vehicle air bag landing system.

item.title: NASA EDGE: NASA 101
item.description: Featuring: Geocaching, NASA 101

item.title: NASA EDGE: Sun-Earth Connection
item.description: Blair turns geocaching into Man vs. Wild, news with Franklin, interviews with Dr. Nicky Fox and Troy Cline and the mighty mighty Space Weather Action Center.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Winter X 11
item.description: Featuring: Winter X Games 11, Spinoff Technology, Space Food Cook-off, Mars, Ski Promo.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Space Conference
item.description: Featuring: 2nd Space Exploration Conference, 21st Century Explorer Podcast Competition, ESA with Franklin.

item.title: NASA EDGE: Premiere
item.description: Featuring: Medianaut quarantine, ESA with Franklin, and an interview with Pat Cosgrove.
